intro: Mananthes damingensis, commonly known as the Daming mountain bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are lance-shaped and have a smooth texture, while its stems are slender and branched. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
